summary: Email correspondence between Jill Greenfield, a UK solicitor, and US law enforcement regarding scheduling an interview with her client, a victim of sexual assault in the UK, in connection with the Epstein investigation. The client is entitled to anonymity under UK law.

persons.name: Jill Greenfield
persons.context: UK solicitor representing a client who is a victim of sexual assault in the UK, corresponding with US law enforcement to schedule an interview for her client in London regarding the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: Jill Greenfield is the solicitor representing a client who is a victim of sexual assault and is being sought for an interview in the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Initial contact regarding client interview
events.description: Jill Greenfield emails US law enforcement to discuss the possibility of an interview with her client in London, asserting the client's right to anonymity under UK law.

events.title: Scheduling call for interview
events.description: Follow-up emails to schedule a phone call between Jill Greenfield and US law enforcement team to discuss the parameters of interviewing her client.

locations: Riverbank House, 2 Swan Lane, London EC4R 3TT (Fieldfisher office)
keyFacts: A UK-based victim of sexual assault, represented by solicitor Jill Greenfield, is being sought for an interview by US authorities in connection with the Epstein investigation.
The victim is entitled to automatic anonymity under UK Statute as a victim of sexual assault that occurred in the UK, and does not waive that right.
The correspondence involves coordination between UK legal counsel and a US law enforcement team including prosecutors from the Southern District of New York and FBI/NYPD task force members.
The communications focus on scheduling a call and potentially an in-person interview in London, highlighting the international dimension of the investigation.
